newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian UCB and Electrabel hit by goverment tax.
newsitem.headline: Belgian UCB and Electrabel hit by goverment tax.

text.p: Belgian pharmaceutical and chemicals group UCB and utility company Electrabel both closed sharply down on Monday after the Belgian government announced a 10 billion francs austerity package.
Electrabel, which closed down 0.77 percent to 7,770 francs, will see the tax on its profits rise to 14 percent from 12 percent, raising 1.5 billion francs in 1997.
UCB lost 2.56 percent, to close down 89,350 francs after the goverment announced a tax on the turnover of pharmaceutical companies will be increased to four percent from one percent.
